service

Class PDFService

  • java.lang.Object
    • service.PDFService

  • public final class PDFService
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the creation and signing of forms.
    Author:
    Tristen Kreutz, Cesar Guzman

    • Method Detail

      • createAuthorizationRequest

        public static Document createAuthorizationRequest(java.lang.String sin,
                                                  java.lang.String fName,
                                                  java.lang.String lName)
                                           throws ConfigException,
                                                  java.io.IOException
        Creates an authorization request form filled in with the user's name and sin number.
        Parameters:
        sin - String The social insurance number of the user.
        fName - String The first name of the user.
        lName - String The last name of the user.
        Returns:
        Document The record of the encrypted authorization request pdf document that was created.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - If the config file was not found.
        java.io.IOException - If the authorization request file cannot be found.

      • signForm

        public static Document signForm(java.lang.String signatureDataURL,
                                java.lang.String parcelID)
                         throws ConfigException
        Creates a signed form from a signature and a form.
        Parameters:
        signatureDataURL - String The signature in the form of a string of characters.
        parcelID - String The id number for the parcel containing the form.
        Returns:
        Document The record of the encrypted signed pdf form document that was created.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - If the config file is missing.

      • init

        private static void init()
                  throws ConfigException
        Initializes the config-derived semi-constants in this class.
        Throws:
        ConfigException - if the config file is missing.
